intro: Oreocharis tribracteata, commonly known as the three-bract oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows in rocky or forested areas and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
